intro: Stylidium recurvum, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its unique, zigzag-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that are typically borne on short, erect stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Stylidium recurvum is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds due to its vibrant floral display.
